Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2009 10:38AM malyssajon wrote: dani42 I'm getting something for nausea too, I just usually throw up once after surgery and that's me done. I went to preop today and I felt like they really didn't tell me anything, physio went over some of the exercises to do after but that was about it. Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2008 05:13PM malyssajon wrote: Cheryl emends is available in Ontario as my med onc mentioned it and so did another I talked who recommended it for me for my next round on Friday! So definitely ask for it, I'm willing to pay any amount of money too just so I don't feel like I did for my last treatment. Hope it works out for you! Linda from Hamilton Ontario
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2008 10:49AM malyssajon wrote: I just had my second trt of AC yesterday- round 3 Nov. 21, and I'm so happy my doctor agreed to give me Emends...what a difference. I only had slight nausea at 1am last night but today and all of yesterday I was great. So I took another today and I'm sure I'll keep feeling great. It just made my day that the doctors actually listened especially since my first round they sure weren't. My hair is starting to fall out too, I'm thinking I shaving mine tomorrow! I'm a little apprehensive but I'm sure I'll be fine when it's over. Hope everyone has a good weekend and a good next week! Linda in Hamilton

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2009 08:26PM malyssajon wrote:  I had neoadjuvant also, I had 3 AC...it didn't shrink fast enough for my onc so I started my 4 taxol...tumour shrunk from 6cm to under 2cm with the taxol. Will be getting surgery later this month than 5 wks of rads and herceptin every 3 wks. I'm two weeks out from my last chemo and still have numbness in my fingers and bone pain in my legs..I still get tired a lot too but I'm really happy the chemo worked...it was definitely worth it and doable!!
